p: In Nigeria, the leaves and roots are useful in treating boils, leprosy, skin diseases, eye pains, and inflammation [ 16]. It has been shown to possess antidysenteric [ 17], analgesic [ 18], fertility, antispasmodic, and muscle relaxation properties [ 19, 20]. It has also been shown to possess anti-inflammatory and antipyretic properties [ 21]. The leaves and roots are also useful in treating hepatitis, breast myiasis sores, and arthritis [ 21, 22]. It has been reported to exhibit radioprotective, cardioprotective, and hepatoprotective properties [ 23â€“ 25]. Phytochemical screenings have shown that A. conyzoides extract root contains various phytochemical constituents, including flavonoids, saponins, tannins, terpenoids, alkaloids, and cardiac glycosides and does not contain anthracene derivatives [ 14, 17, 25].
